meanings.definition: freneticisms: the quality or state of being frenetic
meanings.sent1: Her freneticisms during the game showed her excitement and energy.
meanings.sent2: The freneticisms of the children playing in the park were contagious.
meanings.sent3: His freneticisms in trying to catch the butterfly made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The freneticisms of the busy city streets never seemed to slow down.
meanings.sent5: The freneticisms of the squirrel as it searched for nuts were amusing to watch.

meanings.definition: freneticisms: frenzied or frantic behavior or activity
meanings.sent1: The freneticisms of the shoppers on Black Friday were overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The freneticisms of the storm caused chaos in the small town.
meanings.sent3: The freneticisms of the puppy as it chased its tail were adorable.
meanings.sent4: The freneticisms of the dancers on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The freneticisms of the emergency room were a blur of activity and urgency.
